What advantage do nanobodies have over m: Nanobodies can bind unique epitopes inaccessible to monoclonal antibodies.
Nanobodies have a larger size, allowing them to cover more surface area on the virus.
Nanobodies are derived from human antibodies, making them more compatible with human immune systems.
Nanobodies require more complex production processes, ensuring higher specificity.
What correlation was observed between bi: A correlation was observed for some variants, but not universally across all variants tested.
A strong correlation was observed universally across all variants tested.
No correlation was observed between binding affinity and neutralization efficacy.
A negative correlation was observed, with higher binding affinity leading to lower neutralization efficacy.
What did the study suggest as a strategy: Designing nanobody cocktails targeting multiple non-overlapping epitopes
Focusing on single nanobody formulations for specific variants
Developing nanobodies that target only the most mutable regions
Using nanobodies in combination with traditional vaccines
